climbs.name: Sleep in the Dry Spot
climbs.fa: Alan Pilgrim, Chris Marks, and Pete Henden

content.description: This route could use a clean. Not often done but I figured it was worth adding for history and for helping differentiate routes. Key feature to look for is an overlap.  Complete description can be found in "The Notches" guidebook.
content.location: The first route on the Grunge Wall. Starts below the only overlap near the base of the wall, at a large split birch tree.

content.description: Start just right of Carpet Path. Look for a dirty left facing corner about 10 feet off the ground.  Complete description can be found in "The Notches" guidebook.

The other obvious clean path up the rock about 30 feet left of Sleep in the Dry Spot. Climb up the chunky face on good holds, through a couple horizontal cracks to a fun finish. 

  Edited with additional information from Peter Jackson.
content.protection: Pretty good. A rack of nuts and small cams. 2 Bolt anchor at the top.
content.location: Start 20 feet to the right of The Shield.

content.description: Exactly what it sounds like!  Another route in desperate need of a clean. Climb the dirty rock rib to trees above, taking care not to slip on lichen and blow off the runout moves. Could be a good but spicy lead if it got a clean, but probably best avoided right now.A bit more info in "The Notches" guidebook.
content.location: The small rock rib about 10 ft to the right of the much-climbed Sleep In The Dry Spot's clean gray streak.

content.description: Most people probably walk right by this and don’t even register that it's a route. It probably never gets climbed, but im sure there's someone who will appreciate this route. Start 10 feet right of the route "Just Left".  Quite run out (hence the "R") on currently dirty (lichen) rock.  Complete description can be found in "The Notches" guidebook.
content.location: Left of the classic route "Sleep In The Dry Spot" on the lichen covered rock.

content.description: A dirty, licheny wall uphill from Square Inch Wall, just past The Shield.
